meanings.definition: A long, thin strand of cotton, nylon, or other fibers used in sewing or weaving.
meanings.sent1: I need more thread to finish sewing this button.
meanings.sent2: The thread snapped as she pulled it tight.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the spool of thread, unraveling it all over the room.
meanings.sent4: The thread of friendship between them never broke, no matter the distance.
meanings.sent5: The colorful thread added a beautiful touch to the plain fabric.

meanings.definition: A theme or characteristic running throughout a conversation or piece of writing.
meanings.sent1: The thread of love and loss weaved through the entire novel.
meanings.sent2: The speaker struggled to keep the thread of his argument clear.
meanings.sent3: The thread of humor in her speech kept the audience engaged.
meanings.sent4: The thread of hope shone brightly in her words.
meanings.sent5: The thread of mystery kept readers guessing until the end.

meanings.definition: To pass a thread through the eye of a needle.
meanings.sent1: She carefully threaded the needle before starting to sew.
meanings.sent2: He struggled to thread the tiny needle with his shaky hands.
meanings.sent3: Trying to thread a needle without glasses felt like an impossible task.
meanings.sent4: She deftly threaded the needle, a skill honed over years of practice.
meanings.sent5: He managed to thread the needle on the first try, surprising himself.
